title: Binnington tries to hide puck from Ovi's 900th goal
content: Blues goaltender Jordan Binnington was seen tucking away the puck from Alex Ovechkin's 900th goal into the back of his pants, before he eventually handed it over to a linesman.

title: Jets demote LB Williams amid defensive shakeup
content: In addition to trading cornerstone players Sauce Gardner and Quinnen Williams, the Jets have demoted former All-Pro linebacker Quincy Williams.

title: Vikes QB McCarthy explains alter ego, viral glare
content: J.J. McCarthy acknowledged his new game-day persona -- "Nine," a reference to his jersey number -- and said it is a product of the anger built up over time missed because of injuries.

title: KAT 'still stunned' by trade as Knicks rout Wolves
content: Karl-Anthony Towns said after Wednesday's game that a year later, it's still "weird" to face his former teammates.

title: Panthers' Dowdle fined for '2-pump' celebration
content: Panthers running back Rico Dowdle announced he was fined for his "two-pump" touchdown celebration in Sunday's win over the Packers, with a source telling ESPN the fine was $14,491.

title: Jones unimpressed with 'one-trick pony' Aspinall
content: Former UFC heavyweight champion Jon Jones indicated he was far more impressed with Ciryl Gane than he was with Tom Aspinall in their abbreviated title fight last month, saying he felt Aspinall's wrestling and jiu-jitsu was "incredibly overrated."

title: Sources: LeBron eyes live 5-on-5 play as next step
content: Lakers star LeBron James' next step in his recovery will be taking part in live 5-on-5 reps in practice, sources told ESPN.

title: Cardinals placing QB Murray on injured reserve
content: The Cardinals are placing QB Kyler Murray on IR with a foot injury that kept him out since Week 5, meaning he'll miss at least four more games. Jacoby Brissett will start.

content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

content: England coach Thomas Tuchel knows how good Phil Foden is. But Foden's Champions League brace was a timely reminder of his immense talent.

content: NBA insiders break down the most impactful player, rookie or coach and where all 30 teams stack up in this week's power rankings.

content: The Colts shocked the NFL by dealing two first-round picks and Adonai Mitchell to the Jets for Sauce Gardner. But is this the right time to get aggressive?

title: Jets trade Sauce Gardner to Colts: Last piece to Super Bowl puzzle? What's N.Y. thinking?
content: The 7-2 Colts are going all-in on a Super Bowl run, while trading the CB was just part of the Jets' busy day.

content: This season hasn't gone according to plan for LSU, but one member of the school's band is living his dream.

content: The NHL is back at the Games (Feb. 11-22). Here's a look at which players will make the cut for the big five.

content: Sense Arena is the first NHL/NHLPA-licensed virtual and mixed-reality platform, and players are using it to train.

content: Toronto almost dethroned the mighty Dodgers by prioritizing contact. Will other teams follow the model?

content: With Jordi Alba and Sergio Busquets retiring after the season, it's time for Inter Miami's cast of former Barcelona standouts to put up or shut up.

content: If the 2027 World Cup started today, which players would be on the UWSNT roster? Jeff Kassouf takes a look at who is -- and who isn't -- going to make the cut.

content: A closer look at Austin Reaves' incredible early-season production, and whether it's wise for fantasy managers to trade him now.

title: What to know ahead of Brazilian Grand Prix sprint weekend
content: Formula 1 has reached round 21 and heads to Interlagos, Brazil for the São Paulo Grand Prix. Everything you need to know for the upcoming sprint weekend.

title: Women's boxing divisional rankings: New No. 1 at junior middleweight
content: Mikaela Mayer is ranked in two divisions following her win over Mary Spencer at 154 pounds. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'Craziness': Brazilian model reacts after Rahul's Haryana voter-fraud allegation — Watch
content: A Brazilian model, Larissa, expressed shock after her photograph appeared multiple times in Haryana's voter list, a claim highlighted by Rahul Gandhi alleging widespread voter fraud. Gandhi presented evidence of a single foreign model's image being used for various Indian names, questioning the integrity of the electoral rolls. The Congress leader asserted that approximately 25 lakh voter records were manipulated.

title: ‘Roti palatati rehni chahiye’: Lalu calls for ‘young govt’ in Bihar
content: As Bihar's first phase of voting commenced, RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav advocated for a "young government" led by his son Tejashwi Yadav, emphasizing the need for change after two decades. Meanwhile, Rabri Devi sharply criticized Prime Minister Modi and the BJP regarding law and order, accusing party members of violence and abduction.

title: 'Won’t tolerate a Khan as Mumbai mayor': BJP neta’s warning after Mamdani’s NYC win
content: Mumbai BJP's new president, Ameet Satam, pledged to safeguard the city's identity ahead of BMC polls, prioritizing infrastructure, housing, and safety. He vowed to install a BJP mayor, citing concerns over communal division and alleged BMC corruption. Satam highlighted past development projects and promised transparency in civic governance.

title: ChatGPT Go free for 1 year in India- check 10 top features to use at zero cost
content: OpenAI is offering a free 12-month ChatGPT Go subscription to Indian users. This plan provides enhanced features like extended GPT-5 access, voice mode, and advanced data analysis. Eligible users can redeem this limited-time offer through the ChatGPT web and Google Play Store.

title: 4 caught dumping garbage roadside in Bengaluru, woman dances in front of CCTV
content: Four individuals were caught on CCTV dumping garbage and then dancing in Mico Layout, Bengaluru. Residents expressed outrage over the disrespectful act. The offenders were identified, fined Rs 1,000 each, and authorities emphasized that civic violations are not a joke, vowing to continue night surveillance.

title: 'Aap bahut glow karte ho': Harleen stumps PM with 'skincare' googly — watch
content: Team India's Harleen Deol lightened the mood during a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi by asking about his skincare routine, leaving everyone in splits. The Prime Minister, smiling, attributed his glow to the blessings of the people. The team was celebrating their recent global title victory.

title: Who was Anunay Sood? Family, net worth and more of the travel influencer who passed away at 32
content: Dubai-based travel influencer Anunay Sood, known for his stunning drone photography and adventure content, has passed away at 32 in Las Vegas. With a significant following on Instagram and YouTube, Sood was recognized by Forbes India's Top 100 Digital Stars for three consecutive years. The cause of his death remains unknown.

title: 'Success takes time': Nvidia CEO tells Mark Zuckerberg
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on generative AI and their entrepreneurial journeys. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out of college like Zuckerberg, given Nvidia's long path to becoming a $5 trillion company.

title: Chai, momos & early interviews: How Mamdani spent his 1st day as NYC Mayor-elect
content: New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, had a busy first day, marked by interviews, announcements, and meetings. A highlight was lunch with Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez at Laliguras Bistro, where they enjoyed Indian cuisine. Mamdani, a democratic socialist, secured a significant victory in the mayoral elections, defeating established political figures.

title: India starts blocking use of China-linked satellites by homegrown broadcasters
content: India is restricting satellite usage linked to Chinese entities for domestic broadcasters and teleporters, enhancing national security amid geopolitical instability. This move encourages the development of domestic satellite capabilities, with authorities denying applications from Chinese and Hong Kong-based operator.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: 'Large plume of fire': Video shows UPS plane exploding after engine detaches in Kentucky
content: A Honolulu-bound UPS cargo plane crashed shortly after takeoff from Louisville, killing 12 people and igniting a massive fire. The MD-11 aircraft, carrying 38,000 gallons of fuel, experienced engine detachment during takeoff. The crash site, which included a petroleum recycling facility and auto parts warehouse, saw ruptured storage tanks fueling the blaze.

title: Namo No. 1! Victorious Team India presents PM Modi with a special jersey - watch
content: Fresh from their World Cup victory, Team India presented Prime Minister Narendra Modi with a special jersey. The team expressed gratitude for his encouragement, highlighting his inspirational role in their historic triumph and the progress of women in sports.

title: Joy Crizildaa hits back at Madhampatty Rangaraj’s 'Blackmail' claim
content: Fashion designer Joy Crizildaa has countered chef-actor Madhampatty Rangaraj's "blackmail" accusation by releasing a video of him speaking affectionately.  The clip, allegedly sent by Rangaraj during a trip, has ignited debate online, with many supporting Crizildaa. This development follows a Women's Commission inquiry where Rangaraj reportedly admitted to the marriage.

title: How a 'pro‑Palestinian' Zohran Mamdani became mayor of ‘Jew York’
content: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani is poised to become New York City's next mayor, challenging the city's political establishment. Despite a pro-Palestinian stance that polarized voters, Mamdani engaged with the Jewish community and resonated with younger, liberal voters prioritizing social justice and affordability, securing unexpected support.

title: 'Easier to travel to Dubai': Lack of trains derails voting plans of Bihari migrants
content: Migrant labourers from Bihar in Hyderabad face difficulties voting in state assembly elections due to a severe shortage of trains. High ticket prices and limited availability prevent many from returning home, despite their desire to participate in the electoral process for better opportunities.

title: ‘Troll sena’: PM Modi takes dig at critics who mocked Team India after early three losses - watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the Indian women's cricket team for their World Cup performance, acknowledging the trolls they faced. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur and Vice-captain Smriti Mandhana expressed how the PM's words served as significant motivation. Deepti Sharma shared her inspiration from Modi's past encouragement and her personal beliefs.

title: Watch: Armed US immigration agents drive off with toddler; father detained in raid
content: US citizen arrested near LA Home Depot, his toddler daughter transported in his car by immigration officers.  Bystanders filmed the incident, raising concerns.  The child was later reunited with family.  Officials cited the man's alleged assault and discovery of a stolen gun, but didn't explain the car transport method.

title: Gold and silver price prediction today: Will the yellow metal continue to fall?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold prices show signs of exhaustion, potentially heading towards 117000-115000 levels before a rebound, according to Nuvama's Abhilash Koikkara. Traders are advised caution and to buy near support. Silver faces pressure, with a target of 141500, and selling on rallies is recommended amid dollar strength and rising yields.

title: 'Used pillow to muffle cries': Desperate for money, mason, wife kill 65-yr-old
content: A mason and his wife, facing financial hardship, murdered their 65-year-old landlady in Bengaluru to steal her 30gm mangalsutra. The couple, who had rented the ground floor six months prior, confessed to strangling the woman after posing as potential TV buyers. Police arrested them within a day, their suspicious behavior and a missing pillow aiding the investigation.

title: Delhi’s ‘Money Heist’: How ‘Professor’, ‘Berlin’ and ‘Amanda’ duped 200 people of Rs 50 cr
content: Police have busted a gang that staged a real-life Money Heist. The criminals, using aliases from the popular TV series, defrauded 200 people of Rs 50 crore. They operated a fake online trading scheme, promising high returns. The operation was uncovered after a victim reported a Rs 22 lakh loss. Three key members have been arrested.

title: How this brave dog became the first animal in space and made history
content: Laika, a stray dog from Moscow, became the first living creature to orbit Earth aboard Sputnik 2 in 1957. Her one-way mission, intended to gather data on life in space, tragically ended within hours due to overheating. Despite her sacrifice, the vital information gathered paved the way for future human space missions.

title: Indian-origin Ghazala Hashmi breaks barriers: Hyderabad-born leader becomes Virginia’s LG; leaders hail her achievement
content: Ghazala Firdous Hashmi, originally from Hyderabad, has made history as the first Muslim woman, first person of Indian origin, and first South Asian American elected Lieutenant Governor of Virginia. Her journey from Malakpet to Virginia's corridors of power highlights the strength of education and diversity, inspiring many across both nations.

title: Is MS Dhoni finally retiring? CSK CEO breaks silence - watch
content: Chennai Super Kings CEO Kasi Viswanathan has confirmed MS Dhoni will play in IPL 2026, dispelling immediate retirement rumors. Despite a challenging IPL 2025 season, Dhoni himself stated he has time to decide on his future, emphasizing the physical demands of top-level cricket.

title: FIFA create new peace prize: Trump likely to win; to be announced at World Cup draw
content: FIFA has launched the annual FIFA Peace Prize, recognising individuals who unite people and bring hope. The inaugural award will be presented during the 2026 World Cup draw in Washington. FIFA President Gianni Infantino highlighted football's role in promoting peace. Speculation is rife about the first recipient, with US President Donald Trump being a potential candidate.

title: Parents, children watch as armed ICE officers detain teacher inside Chicago preschool
content: Armed immigration officers apprehended an undocumented teacher at a Chicago preschool, sparking outrage. Parents witnessed the dramatic arrest, with the teacher reportedly shouting she had papers. This incident marks a departure from previous policies protecting schools as sensitive locations. Officials claim she was detained in a vestibule after fleeing a vehicle, but witnesses and local officials dispute the account.

title: Poor heart health in middle age increases risk of dementia: Here's what a study found
content: New UCL research reveals that even silent heart damage in middle age significantly increases dementia risk later in life.  The study found higher troponin levels, indicating subtle heart injury, were linked to a 38% greater chance of dementia decades later, highlighting midlife as a crucial period for heart health to protect the brain.

title: Miles Teller reveals surprising detail about Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s wedding plans
content: Miles Teller anticipates Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's wedding will be "the wedding of the century." While unsure of his own invitation, the actor expressed immense happiness for the couple, whom he has known for years.  Teller believes their union is a testament to finding a lifelong companion, and he's certain their celebration will be truly impressive.

title: TN hidden camera scandal: Spy cam found in Tata Electronics hostel bathroom; woman, boyfriend held
content: A woman employee and her boyfriend were arrested for installing a hidden camera in a women's hostel bathroom. The camera was found in a room at Vidiyal Residency, a hostel for Tata Electronics employees. The discovery led to protests and many women returning home. Police are investigating for more cameras and reviewing footage.

title: Bihar elections phase 1: 121 seats at stake; key constituencies, top candidates
content: Voting has commenced for the initial phase of the Bihar Assembly elections 2025. Over 3.75 crore voters are casting ballots in 121 constituencies. Key leaders like Tejashwi Yadav and Samrat Choudhary are in the fray. Security measures are in place for a smooth process. Several prominent seats are witnessing intense contests, with new voters playing a crucial role.

title: Password for Louvre’s security system was ‘LOUVRE’ — and social media can’t stop laughing
content: A recent security audit of the Louvre has exposed alarming cybersecurity lapses, including a video surveillance system password of "LOUVRE." This revelation follows a brazen daylight heist of crown jewels. Reports indicate the museum has long suffered from major IT vulnerabilities, with outdated systems and weak credentials, raising serious concerns about the protection of priceless cultural heritage.

title: 5th mishap in 3 months: Is Mumbai's iconic monorail on right tracks?
content: A monorail coach derailed near Wadala during a system trial, reportedly due to a suspected glitch in the signalling and switching mechanism. The incident, which occurred on the Wadala-GTB Nagar section, saw the coach tilt on the beam. Engineers were testing new technology aimed at improving train control. Minor injuries were sustained by one technical staff member.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 25,650; BSE Sensex up over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 went above 25,650, BSE Sensex was up over 300 points.

title: Eagles’ Saquon Barkley injury puts Week 10 Game vs Packers in doubt
content: Philadelphia Eagles running back Saquon Barkley's availability for the Week 10 Monday Night Football game against the Green Bay Packers is uncertain. Barkley sustained a groin injury in Week 8. Backup Tank Bigsby performed well in his absence. The team is proceeding cautiously with Barkley's recovery. An official injury report will provide clarity.

title: Lakers legend praises Bronny James after strong game vs Trail Blazers
content: Bronny James showcased a standout performance for the Los Angeles Lakers against the Portland Trail Blazers, contributing five points and six assists. Lakers legend James Worthy lauded the young guard's game, calling it potentially his best yet. Coach JJ Redick also praised Bronny's defensive intensity and physicality, highlighting his significant contributions in a crucial fourth-quarter stretch.

title: Who is Brian Schottenheimer’s wife? Inside Cowboys coach’s life and marriage
content: Gemmi Schottenheimer has been a steadfast support for her husband, NFL coach Brian Schottenheimer, navigating the unpredictable world of professional football. Her resilience and quiet strength have been crucial through career highs and lows, including team changes and personal family challenges. Gemmi's unwavering presence has been a constant, shaping Brian's journey and their family's life.

title: Prince Harry upset as Meghan Markle’s World Series posts spark online backlash
content: Prince Harry reportedly feels uncomfortable with Meghan Markle's recent Instagram posts, which he believes are 'parading him around' and linking her new brand to their royal past. Sources suggest Harry dislikes how Meghan leverages their royal history for her lifestyle brand, citing a candle named after their wedding date and her use of royal initials.

title: Gautam Gambhir pulls Shubman Gill aside for serious chat ahead of 4th T20I - Watch
content: Shubman Gill's batting struggles continue on India's tour of Australia, with low scores in both T20Is and ODIs. Head coach Gautam Gambhir was seen having a serious discussion with the young batter ahead of a crucial T20I. This match presents a key opportunity for Gill to regain form and confidence.

title: Big test for Trump: US Supreme Court raises doubts on legality of reciprocal tariffs
content: The Supreme Court is hearing cases challenging President Trump's reciprocal tariffs, implemented under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. Justices expressed skepticism regarding the legality of using emergency legislation for broad tariff imposition, questioning potential infringement on congressional taxing authority. The ruling could significantly impact global trade and presidential powers.

title: UP Board exam 2026: Class 10 & 12 schedule out; check & download timetable
content: UP Board timetable 2026 for Class 10 and 12 has been released by the Uttar Pradesh Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (UPMSP). The matric and intermediate exams will begin from February 18 and continue till March 12, 2026, with morning and afternoon shifts. Students can download the complete datesheet from the official UPMSP website. The schedule includes theory and practical exams for all streams, including Science, Commerce, Arts, Vocational subjects, and languages, along with detailed day-wise and subject-wise timings.

title: Engine fell off: What led to the deadly UPS plane crash in Kentucky?
content: A UPS cargo jet crashed in Louisville after its left engine reportedly detached and caught fire moments after takeoff. The MD-11, carrying a significant fuel load, ignited a massive blaze that spread across a wide area. Investigators have recovered the black boxes and are focusing on the engine failure. All three pilots aboard perished in the incident.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Deputy Vice President Aakash K Hindocha recommends buying Delhivery, Kalpataru Projects International, and Gravita India. He notes Nifty's recent pullback near 26100 and Bank Nifty's double inside bar formation.

title: Netflix Institutes Ad Reach Metric As Commercials Cross 190 Million Viewers
content: Netflix said on Wednesday that ads on its platform have reached over 190 million monthly active viewers (MAVs) globally, as the streaming giant instituted the new metric to measure its ad reach in terms of people instead of accounts.

title: Woman Techie, Jailed In Gujarat, Behind Bomb Hoaxes To Bengaluru Schools
content: In a major breakthrough into the growing menace of bomb hoaxes in the country, the Bengaluru Police have arrested a woman already serving time at the Ahmedabad Central Jail for sending multiple bomb threat emails to schools across the city.

title: "What's Your Skincare Routine," Harleen Deol Asks PM Modi. His Reply
content: As Prime Minister Modi met and commended the Indian women's cricket team for their "remarkable resilience and comeback" in the World Cup, he was asked a cheeky question: What is his skin care routine?

title: Video: 2 Killed As Speeding Bike Crashes Into Truck At Andhra Intersection
content: Two young men lost their lives in a horrific road accident in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla early this morning.

title: US Supreme Court Questions Legality Of Donald Trump's Sweeping Tariffs
content: US Supreme Court justices raised doubts on Wednesday over the legality of President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs in a case with implications for the global economy that marks a major test of Trump's powers.

title: Man Dies By Suicide Over Viral Video Of Public Urination In Maharashtra
content: A 28-year-old man died by suicide after a video of him and his friend urinating in public went viral, in Maharashtra' Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar.

title: US Man Arrested During Raid. Cops Then Drove Away With His 1-Year-Old
content: Federal immigration officers in Los Angeles arrested a US citizen during a raid outside a Home Depot store, then two of them got into his car and drove off with the man's toddler strapped into a car seat in the back, advocates and family said.

title: A Mother's Dilemma In Fight Between Tejashwi Yadav, Brother Tej Pratap
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal patriarch Lalu Yadav may have expelled his elder son Tej Pratap from the family and the party, but his wife Rabri Devi is still torn between Tej and the younger Tejashwi Yadav, who is set to carry forward his father's legacy.

title: Virginia's New Lieutenant Governor Is "Deeply Attached To Hyderabad"
content: India-born American politician Ghazala Hashmi, who was elected as Virginia's Lieutenant Governor, had visited her hometown of Hyderabad a decade ago, displaying a profound attachment to the city, according to her cousin.

title: 4 Brothers, All Armymen, Arrested For Assaulting Cops At Banke Bihari Temple
content: Four brothers have been arrested for allegedly assaulting police personnel deployed at the Banke Bihari temple in Vrindavan and handed over to the military police for action, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Al Jazeera Journalists In Gaza Served As Terrorists, Claims Israel Defense Forces
content: The Israel Defense Forces has declassified a trove of intelligence documents alleging that several Al Jazeera journalists operating in Gaza were directly affiliated with Hamas and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ).

title: What If Kimmel Apologised For Charlie Kirk Remarks? Erika "Doesn't Need It"
content: Recalling her conversation with Sinclair Broadcast Group, which airs "Jimmy Kimmel Live", Erika Kirk said, an apology should come from the heart else she 'doesn't want it'.

title: Inexpert Loco Pilot, Speed Warning Ignored: Early Findings Of Bilaspur Train Crash
content: Many questions remain unanswered over Tuesday's train crash in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur that killed 11 people and critically injured 20 others.

title: Bihar Assembly Elections Phase 1 2025 Live Updates: Active Participation Of Women Marks Phase 1 Voting In Bihar Assembly Polls
content: The first phase of the Bihar assembly polls saw several senior political figures cast their votes early on Thursday. Among the early voters were RJD leader and INDIA bloc Chief Minister candidate Tejashwi Yadav

title: Lalu Yadav, Nitish Kumar Vote In Bihar Polls, 27% Turnout At 11 am: 10 Facts
content: The high-profile battle for Bihar has begun, with half the state's 243 seats voting today in the first of the two-phase election. Led by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, the ruling NDA is hoping for yet another term in the state.

title: "20 Years Enough": Lalu Yadav's Roti-Vote Parallel - And A Change Message
content: Shortly after casting his vote in the first phase of the Bihar Assembly election, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) patriarch Lalu Prasad Yadav drew a parallel between politics and roti and advocated for change

title: "Disgusting": Mamdani Reacts After "Swastika" Painted Outside Jewish School
content: New York's Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani has condemned an attack on a Jewish school in Brooklyn, where a red swastika was painted a day after the Democrat clinched the historic victory.

title: 'Misinformation': Nigeria Rejects US Allegation Of Religious Freedom Violation
content: Nigeria's government rejected on Wednesday its designation by the United States as a "country of particular concern" over alleged religious freedom violations, saying the move was based on misinformation and faulty data.

title: 'LOUVRE' Was Louvre Museum's Security Password, Reveals Probe After Heist
content: Weeks after a daring $102 million daylight robbery in the Louvre Museum in Paris, investigators have uncovered a stunning flaw in the institution's digital defences.

title: Tech Founder Spends Rs 4 Lakh On Blinkit In Just 60 Days. Internet Reacts
content: Quick delivery apps such as Blinkit, Instamart and Zepto have become a lifeline for those last-minute grocery needs. But this tech founder has taken instant convenience to a whole new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona, Bayern eyeing Vlahovic
content: Several European clubs are linked with a move for Juventus' Dusan Vlahovic. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Women's college volleyball Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: the women's college volleyball season is in the stretch run . there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the top eight teams in each region serve as first- and second-round hosts .

title: Fast break: Morant's struggles, Kuminga's breakout and more
content: we'll start with a high-altitude view of the league and zoom in on the details that matter . we have to talk about Giannis Antetokounmpo . he's averaged 34.0 points per game on 68.1% shooting through six contests .

content: the lone ACC team in the bracket if it were released today would be no. 14 Virginia . the ACC is already playing from behind, and it's only the first ranking of the season . teams with Would be in status below are in this week's bracket based on the committee ranking .

title: The Bilas Index: Jay Bilas picks his top 68 teams this season
content: the Bilas Index is the most powerful and consequential instrument of basketball wisdom and judgment known to humankind . it serves as much more than a guide or a road map to this men's college basketball season . the Bilastrator's immense and powerful brain is superior in processing basketball performance, potential and ability .

title: ⬇ Bottom 10: Georgia Tech latest to be wrecked
content: we love college football most of all for its dedication to traditions . "November Rain," guns N' Roses Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, is located in the very empty wardrobe box . a season of Auburn football penning more drama than a "General Host" season .

title: Ducks, Hawkeyes, trench football: Why you should bet the under on Oregon-Iowa
content: Oregon is 7-1 overall and 4-1 in the Big Ten, but now comes a trip to Iowa . the Hawkeyes sit at 6-2 and 4--1 in conference play, just outside the top 25 at no. 26 in the AP poll .

title: Champions League as it happened: Man City breeze past BVB, six goals in Brugge-Barça
content: We are back with  UEFA Champions League  action as we had some great matches on this second day of Matchday 4. Manchester City  were able to win with ease against  Borussia Dortmund  by winning 4-1 at the Etihad. It was goals galore in Belgium as  Club Brugge  and  Barcelona  played to a six-goal thriller that ended in a 3-3 draw. Also, we had  Newcastle United  beating  Athletic Club  2-0 and  Internazionale  beating  Kairat Almaty  2-1. Enjoy all the action from Wednesday's matches.

title: Men's boxing divisional rankings: Joshua Buatsi wins but drops three spots?
content: the light heavyweight fight was marred by clinching and a lack of action . the decision was widely panned on social media as the early work by Zach Parker appeared to give him the edge against the betting favorite . a third of the judges saw it 96-94 and 95-95 .

title: SIT mulls using portable metal testers to quantify gold content in Sabarimala temple panels
content: Officials say such devices, which use X-ray-based technology for on-the-spot analysis, might help investigators estimate the gold content of the original alloy encasings without damaging them

title: Union Minister Suresh Gopi again bats for AIIMS in Kerala's Alappuzha
content: Suresh Gopi says that without the foundation stone of an AIIMS being laid in Kerala, he ‘will not go to people seeking votes’

title: OpenAI introduces IndQA benchmark to evaluate AI systems on Indian culture, languages
content: OpenAI noted that it worked with Indian experts across languages and domains in order to develop its new IndQA benchmark

title: Congress accuses NDA of making 'false promises', neglecting development of Bhagalpur, Seemanchal
content: The NITI Aayog report states: 52% of the population of Araria, 50% of the population of Purnia, more than 45% of the population of Kishanganj-Katihar, still struggle with multidimensional poverty, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: ‘20 years, too long!’: Lalu Prasad calls on Bihar's voters to usher in change
content: Lalu Prasad calls for change in Bihar’s leadership as voting began in the 2025 Assembly elections. Voter turnout reached 13.3% by 9 a.m. in this critical contest for State governance

title: Arunachal Sainik School student death: Sister alleges torture by seniors; eight students detained
content: Arunachal Pradesh Police said the students were produced before the Juvenile Justice Board in Pasighat

title: Triangular contest at Anta Assembly seat poses challenge to parties amid caste mobilisation
content: The BJP’s mobilisation of voters with micromanagement on the caste lines is being countered by the Congress with the appeal to cast votes for development, keeping in mind the contributions of its candidate, former Minister Pramod Jain.

title: Bihar polls: With Tejashwi and Tej Pratap in the fray, Rabri Devi sends ‘best wishes to both sons’; casts vote in Patna
content: Tej Pratap, the incumbent Hasanpur MLA, is contesting from Mahua, a seat he first won in 2015 during his electoral debut on an RJD ticket

title: Nagaland IAS Induction row: JCC intensifies strike, launches tools down strike
content: Joint Coordination Committee in Nagaland intensifies protests with a ‘tools down’ strike, demanding the restoration of a key vacancy circular amid ongoing government inaction

title: Telangana: Rowdy-sheeter hacked to death in clash at Jagadgirigutta bus stop
content: According to police, the two men had been at odds over control of prostitution networks operating in the locality

title: Bihar polls: Vaishali DM urges people to take part in 'festival of democracy' through her song
content: “People of Vaishali, listen to my call, please cast your vote first, then have breakfast,” urged the IAS officer through her song

title: Odisha RTC bus catches fire near Salur, passengers safe
content: The driver quickly evacuated all five passengers on board, ensuring their safety before the fire could spread

title: Kerala govt allocates ₹99.9 lakh for Manaveeyam Veedhi-model street in Dharmadam to boost tourism
content: The project will include road-front beautification, a children’s play zone with advanced equipment kiosks, a cafeteria and open-air theatre. It is expected to be completed within 10 months

title: Bihar polls Phase 1: PM Modi, NDA leaders urge people to vote with full enthusiasm
content: Today Bihar celebrates the first phase of the festival of democracy. Му appeal to all voters of this phase in the assembly elections is that they should vote with full enthusiasm, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: HRD Minister Lokesh calls for complete overhaul of higher education curriculum in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Minister instructed the officials to link ITIs and universities with industries by November-end and to integrate private colleges also with the Skills Portal to ensure campus placement guarantees

title: Doctors welcome Kerala High Court order against ‘Dr.’ prefix for physiotherapists
content: HC order follows a petition by Indian Association of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation against alleged unauthorised use of the prefix by physiotherapists and occupational therapists

title: India’s growing e-com dominance masks a persistent gender digital divide: Nasscom Foundation
content: According to the foundation, ONDC Network is expected to help bridge the digital divide by building capacities and empowering 200 women entrepreneurs to seamlessly enter and thrive in online marketplaces

title: Smartphone prices up by ₹2,000 in India, expected to rise further on increasing storage cost
content: The fluctuation of global prices and the strength of the U.S. dollar against Indian rupee have amplified cost pressures on local assemblers

title: Airlines report “severe” spoofing over Delhi for seven days, govt officials say they are enquiring
content: While it was common to experience GPS spoofing over India’s border with Pakistan, such occurrences over Delhi were unusual, say sources.

title: DRI seizes ₹22 crore Alprazolam from illegal unit in Gujarat; 4 held
content: Alprazolam is a prescription-only psychotropic substance in India, strictly regulated under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, 1985

title: Businessman attacked by armed gang on Kerala highway; car destroyed and valuables stolen
content: Eight-member armed gang, reportedly involved in unaccounted money transfers, destroyed his car which was later recovered by police nearly 30 km away from crime scene

title: Karnataka HC launches quick e-filing dashboard and kiosk for e-filing
content: Also, the court launched a quick e-filing dashboard for filing petitions exclusively on tax matters on its website

title: U.P. man dies in RPF custody, family alleges murder
content: Family members alleged that RPF personnel beat him and gave him electric shocks during interrogation. He was later taken to Gonda Medical College, where doctors declared him dead, police said.

title: A section of the Matua community in West Bengal launch hunger strike over SIR issue
content: The hunger strike and protests was started under the leadership of Trinamool Congress MP Mamata Bala Thakur

title: New Bombay HC building should be temple of justice, not seven-star hotel: CJI Gavai
content: CJI Gavai disclosed that initially he was reluctant to attend the foundation stone laying ceremony, but changed his mind when he was told it is not known when a Bombay High Court judge will occupy the top judicial post again

title: Week 11 Anger Index: The case for outrage over BYU's and Miami's CFP rankings
content: the college football playoff committee has released its first top 25 ranking of the year . it's the sport's version of Walmart opening its doors at midnight on black Friday . this year, the committee has said it is considering a new "record strength" metric .

title: Watch: Trump slams NYC voters after Mamdani win; then surprises all with dance moves
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: OpenAI’s ChatGPT Go free annual subscription rolls out in India
content: One year of access to ChatGPT Go, which is OpenAI’s new, low-cost subscription plan, is available in India for free for a limited period

title: Gujarat Deputy CM Harsh Sanghavi, IPS officers to visit border villages
content: A separate session has been arranged with Border Security Force (BSF) officials to review security-related matters, including patrolling operations and the monitoring of anti-national activities along the border

title: Bihar elections Phase 1 voting LIVE: Over 27.5% voter turnout as of 11 a.m.; polling picks up pace across 121 constituencies
content: Patna district has seen the lowest turnout so far with 23.71%. Several top leaders are in fray in this phase, including the Opposition’s CM face Tejashwi Yadav, and over a dozen BJP and JD(U) Ministers in the Nitish government

title: Parakamani case probe: CID sets up temporary office in Tirupati
content: CID DGP Ravi Shankar Ayyanar appeals to the public to share information on the case by dialling 9440700921 or sending emails to adgcid@ap.gov.in

title: BRS cadre protest against ‘cap’ on cotton procurement in Adilabad
content: The situation turned tense after the protesters made a vain attempt to enter into MP’s residence to register their protest against the alleged cap

title: CM Stalin unveils Winners Trophy for Hockey Men’s Junior World Cup
content: The World Cup matches will be held in Chennai and Madurai from November 28 to December 10, according to an official release.

title: Envoy to represent India at COP30 Leaders' Summit; Environment Minister Yadav to join later
content: At COP30, India is expected to underline that developed countries can restore trust by honouring their past commitments and scaling up predictable, grant-based funding for adaptation and loss and damage

title: 'Drishyam'-style murder in Ahmedabad: Man's body buried in his house; wife's paramour held
content: Ansari, who used to work as mason, came to Ahmedabad from Bihar in 2016 after his love marriage with Ruby and the couple has two children

title: NREGA Sangharsh Morcha threatens protests in Bengal if MGNREGA not resumed by December
content: The Supreme Court of India on October 27 has removed all the road blocks in the resumption of the MGNREGA scheme by dismissing the petition of the Union government. Prior to this the Calcutta High Court has directed the resumption of the scheme from August 1

title: The malleable Code of Conduct
content: Successive governments at both the Centre and various States, representing the entire spectrum of political parties in India, are breaking the spirit of MCC

title: Trinamool using SIR to deflect attention from its 14- year misrule in Bengal, says BJP
content: WB BJP president Samik Bhattacharya said that the Trinamool Congress can always approach the Supreme Court if the party has any opposition to the SIR.

title: Siblings arrested in Coimbatore gang rape case were on police watchlist
content: T. Karuppasamy, alias Satheesh, 30, and T. Kaleeswaran, alias Karthik, 21, were among the 3,000 history-sheeters in the list, which included local history-sheeters and those from other districts.

title: Anyone intimidating society through illegal land grabs to be penalized, warns U.P. CM Yogi
content: Mr. Adityanath made the remarks after inaugurating the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Housing Scheme at Ekta Van in Dalibagh in Lucknow on the occasion of Kartik Purnima where he handed over allotment letters of flats to 72 Economically Weaker Section (EWS) families

title: Elevated road corridor in Patigadda to affect 1892 palace complex
content: While only the frontage of the palace gate will be erased, another landmark bastion that used to face the Hussainsagar lake is also set to be demolished for a project that will connect Necklace Road with the busy Rasoolpura Road

title: KKRTC staff urged to take part in sports for physical and mental fitness: chairman Arun Kumar
content: Participation in sports is essential for both physical and mental well-being, said Kalyana Karnataka Road Transport Corporation chairman Arun Kumar Patil

title: Nandini ghee price goes up by ₹90 per kg
content: The Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF) effected a steep increase of nearly 15% on the price of its popular product, Nandini ghee, from Wednesday.

title: ‘No surprise if BJP and alliance do not reach even three digits’: Congress MP Pramod Tiwari ahead of Bihar polls
content: This time, Nitish Kumar's inability to work, his inability to tour, and the way the BJP has ignored him will lead to a reduction in the BJP's seats, the Congress MP said

title: NDA stands for HIRA; Bihar witnessed tremendous growth under Modi, Nitish: BJP president Nadda
content: Mr. Nadda described the RJD as a party of "Rangdari [extortion], Jungle Raj [anarchy] and Dadagiri [intimidation]," and accused its leaders, including Mr. Lalu, Ms. Rabri, Mr. Tejashwi and Misa Bharti, of being out on bail

title: Former Assam MP joins regional party, slams ‘authoritarian’ BJP
content: Rajen Gohain is among those with an RSS past said to be disenchanted with the BJP’s “imported” breed of leaders

title: RCB ownership may change hands; USL initiates strategic review of the investment
content: Investment in sport, although valuable and strategic, is not the company’s core business, says Someshwar, Managing Director, USL

title: SHRC seeks report on condition of ventilators at SAT Hospital
content: Superintendent of Government Medical College Hospital, Thiruvananthapuram, denies  media reports that  11 ventilators at the hospital are not in a working condition. Commission says report must be submitted within a month

title: Labour Minister condemns Pakistan’s abuse of global forum to ‘peddle disinformation’
content: The Union Labour Minister counters Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari’s statement at the World Summit for Social Development in Doha that India weaponises water

title: Shifting candidates and strategies, parties aim to win the crucial Magadh region in Bihar
content: While the NDA faces the challenge of regaining lost turf in what was once its stronghold, the Mahagathbandhan is going all out to maintain its dominance for the third consecutive term in the Magadh region

title: 38 divisions in Kochi Corporation reserved for women after fresh draw of lots
content: The initial draw was challenged in the High Court for erroneously reserving a division that had already been reserved for women in the 2020 elections

title: Yet another straight duel between LDF and UDF on the cards in Pala
content: The once-uneasy alliance between the CPI(M) and KC(M) has evolved into a cohesive partnership with strong grassroots chemistry, while the UDF looks to win back what once its bastion. The Bharatiya Janata Party, buoyed by an expanding ground network, looks to play the dark horse

title: Stubble-burning area in key Punjab districts 20% lower than last year
content: In the week from October 28 to November 4, fire counts have tripled; citing the recent data, expert says reduction in area set afire in three major districts a positive sign

title: FATF releases updated asset recovery framework; India played a key role, says Enforcement Directorate
content: The guidance follows up on one of the most significant global reforms to the FATF standards on confiscation and international cooperation in over three decades, the ED said

title: Defeat BJP-JD(U) to rid Bihar of unemployment, migration, 'goonda raj': Congress' appeal to voters
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh alleged that the NDA has pushed Bihar's bright future into darkness for the sake of its own "power-hungry interests"

title: Archives department to preserve satirist Veloor’s handwritten manuscripts
content: Department decides to take over 20 of Veloor’s most significant handwritten manuscripts, conserve and return them to his kin

title: Bihar polls: JD(U)’s Lalan claims FIR based on ‘doctored’ video
content: Lalan expressed confidence that the investigation will take into account “the full video footage” and will lead to his exoneration

title: Police file FIR in Bilaspur train crash
content: Police say initial findings by Railways, which suggest that the passenger train’s crew failed to control the train at a red signal, will be part of their probe; Commissioner of Railway Safety to begin investigation, says government

title: Chhattisgarh train collision: With parents dead, relatives of toddler who survived worried about his future
content: Rishi, around two years old, sustained injuries on his head and legs in train accident in Chhattisgarh’s Bilaspur

title: Women workers of TATA Electronics in Hosur allege cover-up attempt after discovery of hidden camera in hostel bathroom
content: The workers also alleged that the warden of Vidiyal Residency, the company-provided accommodation, made insensitive comments

title: First phase of Bihar polls on November 6 will decide the fate of big leaders and small parties
content: The Opposition’s CM face Tejashwi Yadav is in the fray, as are Deputy CMs Samrat Choudhary and V.K. Sinha; crucial test for CPI(ML), LJP(RV), VIP; in 2020, Mahagatbandhan won 63 of 121 seats going to polls

title: Bihar polls: NDA banks on reinforced alliance; will welfare schemes work in oppn strongholds?
content: in 2020, opposition had won 61 of the 121 seats that go to polls in the first phase, against NDA's 59 . 'NDA Will Form Govt Again Under Nitish Kumar's leadership': Bihar Dy CM Vijay Sinha Ahead Of Polls Back then, Chirag Paswan's Lok Janshakti Party and Upendra Kushwaha had fought separately .
